channel.title: M. E. Mills
channel.description: Recent content on M. E. Mills

item.title: Edward Hallock Mills
item.description: Edward Hallock Mills, born 25 Mar 1819, Smithtown, NY, died 01 Jan 1908, Brookton, NY. Patriarch of the Mills family. Co-owner, general stores E. H. Mills & Co. in Cofu NY and owner E. H. Mills in Motts Corners/Brookton NY.

item.title: Historical Names
item.description: Brooktondale: from late 1700’s: Cantineville or Cantine’s Mill and a number of other variants. 1840: Mott’s Corners (often spelled Motts Corners) 1883: Brookton Feb 16, 1926: Brooktondale As a nod to Brooktondale’s history, several local businesses have adopted “Brookton” as part of their name, most notably Brookton’s Market. Brooktondale Road: Caroline Valley Community Church: Brookton’s Market:

item.title: Mary Ann Mills
item.description: Mary Ann (Pine) Mills, born 8 Feb 1819, Hempstead NY, died 28 Dec 1895, Brookton NY. Matriarch of the Mills family, first wife of Edward Hallock Mills, married 29 Dec 1850, Hempstead, NY.

item.title: Mills' Home in Brooktondale
item.description: The Mills Home in Brooktondale is located at present-day (2021) 475 Brooktondale Road. View largest available size. View largest available size. View largest available size.

item.title: Horace F. Mills
item.description: Horace F. Mills, born 1854, Staten Island, NY, died 27 October 1876, Corfu NY. Second child of Edward H. and Mary Ann Mills.

item.title: E. H. Mills and M. E. Mills, Mott's Corners and Brookton
item.description: Upon moving to Mott’s Corners, Edward restarted E. H, Mills general store on his own, with his son Jonas working as clerk. Emily would eventually also work as clerk in the store, taking it over upon Edward’s death as M. E. Mills.

item.title: Jonas E. Mills
item.description: Jonas E. Mills, born 1852, Staten Island, NY, died 13 October 1885, Brookton NY. Oldest child of Edward H. and Mary Ann Mills.

item.title: The Baptism of Emily Mills
item.description: April 7, 1907. The following names were added to this Church roll, 15 in all - Miss Marian H. Toby Dead " Alma Personius Letter " Jessie Shurter (Brewer) " Emily Mills " Susie C. Westfall (Lawrence) " Ellen E. Lounsbery (Denman) " Lettie Personius Dead " Pearl Annis letter " Alleine M. Johnston Mrs. Curtis Shurter, Mother + Miss Louise W. Shurter, Daughter letter " C. Esther Vorhis Sister +

item.title: Mary Emily Mills
item.description: Mary Emily Mills, born Dec 1858 Staten Island, NY, died 03 Nov 1937, who went by Emily, was the youngest child of Edward H. and Mary Ann Mills. Owner of M. E. Mills general store in Brookton/Brooktondale NY. Active in the temperance movement and Sunday School teacher and piano player in Brooktonale Congregational Church.

item.title: Temperance Activity
item.description: Temperance groups don't appear to be very strong here. The only mention I found was the "Royal Templars of Temperance" who began meeting in 1878. They didn't seem to be very powerful. No date was given as to when they ceased to exist. — Personal correspondence with Allan Starkweather, Corfu Village Historian — Apr 30, 1886 Quarterly Returns for Independent Order of Good Templars High Bridge Lodge No.

item.title: Hannah Mills
item.description: Hannah (Thatcher) Eastman Mills, born 21 May 1824, England, died 25 Feb 1917, Brookton, NY. Second wife of Edward Hallock Mills, married 30 Dec 1896. Active member of Women’s Christian Temperance Union.

item.title: E. H. Mills & Co., Corfu NY
item.description: Not much is known of E. H. Mills & Co. of Corfu: The E.H. Mills General store was on the NE corner of Main and Allegheny in Corfu. It was open from 1866-1880. The building burned to the ground in a fire in 1899. It is now the site of the M&T Bank building. — May 20, 2021, Personal correspondence with Allan Starkweather, Corfu Village Historian E.

item.title: Ellen Gould
item.description: Ellen Jane (Andrews) Predmore Gould, born 27 Mar 1848, died 31 Oct 1929. Ellen lived in the Mills home for over a decade to help care for Hannah and to help Emily with the home and store. She was a devoted Christian and member of Brookton Baptist Church.
